medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with RUQ abdominal pain lasting for 8 hours, which began after eating a fatty meal the previous night. The pain was described as sharp and radiated to the right flank and right back. She experienced 3 episodes of non-bilious non-bloody emesis and felt clammy at times. She denies experiencing fever and chills. A similar but milder episode occurred 6 weeks ago.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Obesity, Diverticula on colonoscopy, hyperlipidemia treated with lifestyle management, basal cell skin cancer, rotator cuff treated. Previous surgical history includes hammertoe surgery and basal cell carcinoma excision.
medical_history.family_history: Father has coronary artery disease, hypertension, and prostate cancer; Aunt has breast cancer.
